title: Las Vegas Valley fire departments get water-conserving simulators
summary:
The Southern Nevada Water Authority donated engineer training simulators that don’t waste water to fire departments in Las Vegas, North Las Vegas, Henderson and Clark County.
The Southern Nevada Water Authority has given local departments training simulators that will allow engineers — the crew members responsible for operating water pumping systems — to train without wasting millions of gallons of water every year.
Fire departments for Clark County, Las Vegas, North Las Vegas and Henderson received the simulators, which cost a total of $280,000, according to a news release.
Water authority officials conservatively estimate the simulators will save nearly 49 million gallons of water every year.

title: How the Nevada Democratic caucuses will work
summary:
With New Hampshire’s primary voting now complete, the next contest for the Democratic presidential contenders will be the Nevada caucuses on Saturday, February 22, at noon Pacific time.
3) County delegates: Finally, the final vote total in each precinct is then used to assign each viable candidate a certain number of county delegates.
In 2008 and 2016, this was the only result the Nevada Democratic caucuses reported — so, for instance, when Hillary Clinton beat Bernie Sanders 52 percent to 47 percent, those percentages were of county delegates (not actual votes).

title: Henderson marijuana dispensary hosts cannabis-based blood drive
summary:
HENDERSON (KTNV) — Nevada Made Marijuana has partnered with Vitalant to bring a mobile blood donation vehicle to its Henderson dispensary.
The cannabis business said it hopes to not only give back to the community through the blood drive but to also raise awareness to the fact that cannabis users can donate life-saving blood.
The event is scheduled to take place on Feb. 23 from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. at Nevada Made Marijuana, located at 3195 St. Rose Parkway, near Seven Hills Drive.
The dispensary quotes the Red Cross with the following: "The American Red Cross does not test for THC, and legal or illegal use of marijuana is not a cause for blood donation deferral."
Nevada Made Marijuana also says it hopes to break this stigma while being able to guide qualified cannabis-using donors to Nevada's blood banks and donor services.

title: Las Vegas home prices near pre-recession highs
summary:

(Erik Verduzco/Las Vegas Review-Journal) @Erik_VerduzcoMore than 13 years after the market peaked, Las Vegas house prices last month came close to their pre-recession highs.
Las Vegas was ground zero for America’s real estate bubble in the mid-2000s, marked by fast-growing property values, booming construction and widespread home flipping.
Frank Nothaft, chief economist at housing tracker CoreLogic, told the Las Vegas Review-Journal recently that prices were “clearly overvalued” in the mid-2000s but that he doesn’t have the same concern about Las Vegas nowadays.

title: Clark County homicides plummet in 2019
summary:
“Since I’ve been elected sheriff, since day one, my priority has been violent crime,” Clark County Sheriff Joe Lombardo told the Review-Journal on Friday.
In the Las Vegas Valley, only the North Las Vegas Police Department includes fatal police shootings in its official homicide count.
As the largest police department in Southern Nevada, overseeing the city of Las Vegas and unincorporated Clark County, Metro’s annual homicide count often sways the trend in killings for the entire county.
Yet North Las Vegas and Henderson police also responded to fewer killings following a particularly bloody 2018, the deadliest year on record for both cities.
The majority of homicides are clustered in east Las Vegas, the southern portion of North Las Vegas and in and around the Historic Westside, a roughly 3.5-square-mile neighborhood just northwest of downtown Las Vegas known for its storied African-American culture.

title: RSAR Releases November 2019 Existing Home Sales Report
summary:
RENO, Nev. – The Reno/Sparks Association of REALTORS® (RSAR) today released its November 2019 report on existing home sales in Reno, Sparks and Fernley, including median sales price and number of home sales in the region.
The report listed the median sales price for an existing single-family residence in Reno-Sparks in November 2019 at $400,000; a 6 percent increase from November 2018 and no change from October 2019.
The median sales price of existing condominium/townhomes in Reno-Sparks in November 2019 was $230,700; a 30 percent increase from a year ago.
The existing condominium/townhome median sales price for November 2019 in Reno was $257,000; a 50 percent increase from last year.
The existing condominium/townhome median sales price for November 2019 in Sparks was $215,000; a 16 percent increase from last year.

title: More than 141,000 people moved to Nevada in 2018. How many were from California?
summary:
The U.S. Census Bureau crowned Nevada the nation’s fastest-growing state in 2018, and the Silver State ranked second in 2017 and 2016.
About 127,000 people moved to Nevada from other states and another 14,000 came from abroad between July 2017 and July 2018.
According to the estimates, nearly four-in-10 people who moved to Nevada from another U.S. state in those 12 months were from California.
“There are more adults in Nevada that were born in California than born in Nevada,” said Robert Lang, executive director of Brookings Mountain West at UNLV.
“Its a really nice magnet for California,” Lang said.

title: Rising gas costs, winter weather means bigger Southwest Gas bills
summary:
A Southwest Gas truck is seen on Friday, Aug. 17, 2018, in North Las Vegas.
According to Southwest Gas spokesman Sean Corbett, rising gas costs and winter weather conditions had caused customers to see these dramatic price increases.
“(This) can increase the amount of gas that’s used by our customers.”Additionally, Corbett said the utility’s supplier had increased the cost of the natural gas Southwest Gas delivers to customers.
According to documents from Southwest Gas and a November filing with the Nevada Public Utilities Commission, Southwest Gas’ adjusted rates went into effect the first of the year, after the cost of gas in Southern Nevada went up $0.02517 per therm.
In turn, the total annualized revenue for Southwest Gas in Southern Nevada went up 2.6 percent to nearly $454 million.

summary:

(Lexus of Henderson)Lexus of Henderson has made special arrangements with the North Pole to have Santa Claus make a pre-Christmas Eve stop at the dealership Dec. 14 from noon to 3 p.m.Parents, grandparents and special friends are encouraged to bring their children for a one-on-one visit with Santa that includes a free photo opportunity, courtesy of Lexus of Henderson.
“We hope families will take time out of their busy holiday schedules this year to bring their children to Lexus of Henderson to meet and greet Santa Claus and enjoy a little holiday cheer with our Lexus family,” said Ryon Waters, general manager of Lexus of Henderson.

Ask for a free December holiday flyer when you visit the dealership and receive $500 off the purchase of a new Lexus vehicle,” he added.
